content: The BEST FrontEnd out there by far!!! I've tried pretty much all of the frontends out there, some are terrible and some are just okay, but the one thing they almost all have in common is they are very cumbersome and time consuming to setup. Reset Collection is by far the easiest to setup. It's adds all the game art and intro videos automatically and looks very PRO when done. Money well spent!! Don't bother with any other frontend. Installed on a Xiaomi Tablet and Nvidia Shield TV Pro so far
Excellent front-end. Great stuff. Thanks Devs.
Great app, great support, just buy and support the development.

"A' for effort but falls woefully short of usuable. To put this through paces I set up every emulated system this has available for use. I had it run through over 12000 combined from all those systems. My conclusions were that besides the numerous bugs, font issues, horribly ill conceived game selection menus and interface controls there were many issues with controls once a game was started especially in retroarch. Its editable imagery is its only plus.
It works like a treat on the Samsung galaxy tab s7
Crashes
Useless ! if u have a tv box DO NOT BUY IT !! most of the time it should use retroarch which doest work without touch screen ! Obviously the authoer thought well nt to make a trial ‚Ä¶..wasted money

replyContent: Hi, thank you for posting! I'm very sorry that SD card access isn't supported in RESET on Android 11 devices. I'll be looking into this and working on a fix soon for the next release! I'll update this response when that release is out.

content: The best front end that I found easy and simple to install the roms and play quickly without any problem. It actually takes a little while when you are going to install large collections but; It does its job. The most I wish you could put any mp4 intro video that you want for this front end. It would be great.
Really enjoy this Emulator frontend so much that I have it installed on both my phone and tablet. Keep up the great work. Looking forward to more support of Emulators and themes.
1 star because unable to access sd card was working before since update to the new Android 11 not able to access please fix
replyContent: Hi Amos, thank you for posting and letting me know of this issue. I'm very sorry that SD card access isn't supported in RESET on Android 11 devices. I'm planning on getting this fixed for the next release. I'll update you here in this review response when I get that release out.

content: Great frontend, does a better job at IDing my game collection than others. Can't wait to see theme support! Lastly, I am here because of ETAprime. Lets here it for his consistant videos.
I'm loving this app. Is there a way to change the scroll view to a grid view? Great work on the UI, everything works very well. Great job

Don't waste your money, get DIG instead, is free. I bought it yesterday and I'm very disappointed, the GUI is so mediocre, I can't believe they have no themes at all, it feels like "my first app" NOT GOOD AT ALL.
Good one, üëç

This frontend is... Okay. It needs the ability to skip through roms quicker than one at a time. It also needs to find a way to hide the artwork from the phone's photo gallery which is now a mess. I do like the ability to choose which emulator to launch, though. UPDATE: I've changed to 3 stars as I've just restarted using it on my Android TV. I would love it if you could change the views. I'm not expecting Launchbox on a PC interfaces but something with a bit more pizazz! Sticking with RetroX for now.
replyContent: Thank for the review! Sorry about these shortfalls. I'm listening to the community and making updates and improvements! As for skipping through games, you can use the "Scroll to" feature in the menu to skip to games starting with the chosen letter. Also, you can choose a different download location for images in the Settings. Hope this helps.

content: Great app, even greater developer! Simple to use and looks splendid! Although I wish we could sort by chronological order it's still a fantastic app!

I just setup ARC and DIG. Reset CRUSHES them in every way I've tried... ease navigation, quick and easy initial setup, speed to scrape art and launch games, etc. I spend HOURS trying to get ARC Browser working... where Reset took about 30 minutes for the same ROMS (over 300 mix of MAME, N64, PSP, PS1, Sega, etc) Reset works very well when exiting the games/EMUs where ARC was hit-n-miss. Would like to see a few small features added to Reset (like 'update collection' to remove scraped art/games when we deleted ROMs from folders ARC is difficult to use in many ways and missed 50% of the game art when scraping -- and is 2 to 5x slower than Reset. -- Reset hasn't missed any games when scraping DIG is all garbage... wouldn't use it if you paid me to. An

It looks great and is very customizable, but I can't start any app or rom without the app crashing. This makes the app completely useless to me, as I have to start each game through the emulator anyway.
replyContent: Thanks for posting! I'm really sorry that you're getting these crashes when you start an app or game from RESET. Can you please email me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com, and I'll help you out so you can start using RESET without these crashes. Thanks!

content: Really good app, any chance to link the spectrum emulator spectaculator with this app???

Works well with small libraries, I got a couple of issues with it though that unfortunately a few free apps get right. - Loading speed is not great, and stutters a lot with big libraries. So it's a bit unfeasible for arcade collections. - Sometimes game matching is not great, specially for arcade games. - Has a few Retroarch cores missing - This is the most annoying for me: when I remove a game from the console database, it throws me to the top of the library, making batch game removal really tedious and annoying. And sometimes when scrolling it also shoots me back up. - Doesn't have much customization options when it comes to layout selection or even starting the app when the system boots. This is a minor problem for sure. Other than that it works pretty well, support for existing cores and launching is great. The scrapper is one of the best available and supports a lot of native android apps and emulators, which is great. I'd love to see at least a couple of the issues listed above addressed, I would definitely improve its overall score if so.

I love this app but I am quickly growing out of love with it. This is the second time that after an update it has erased a lot of the hard work and countless hours upon hours of organization and finding artwork that I have put in. I am sorry but I can not make time commitments like this anymore only to have half my efforts erased. I am sure the updates have made this app even greater. Don't let my misfortunes stop you from downloading this app. Atleast this developer supports his app.
replyContent: Thanks for posting, Greg. It truly pains me knowing that an update has caused you to lose the precious time and effort that you have put into customizing and setting up your app. I try my best to test updates so this doesn't happen, and I'm so sorry that you were adversely affected. Please email me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com and I'll help out.

content: Put this on my Retroid Pocket 2. Love it. Seems a little slow when I loaded a crapload of games on it. Then realized I only want games that I'm actually gonna play on it. It seems to do much better with smaller libraries. No themes to choose from, but the one that's there is beautiful and really high-end looking Zelda - The Minish Cap shows up as Project Zeldamon with the wrong title and screen art. My only slight gripe Anybody know how to fix?
replyContent: Hey there Kevin! Thanks for the review! Glad that RESET is working for you on the Retroid Pocket 2. I made some performance optimizations specifically for the RP2, but it still runs a bit slow with very very large game sets. As for fixing the mismatched Zelda game, you can fix a game by going to the game's menu > Fix game match üëç

content: Terrible tablet ui Don't waste your money no updates and terrible Update: Still didn't make logo smaller I mean its a simple request don't waste your money the devs have no idea what a ui should be
replyContent: Hi, thanks for posting! I'm so sorry that you're unhappy with he tablet UI! Can you please email me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com so I can hear your thoughts on the UI? As for updates, I planned to update every two weeks, but COVID lockdown has slowed things down. I promise to keep updating the app. I will have a new update out within two weeks.

content: Is it possible to add mame to the list other than that it's great

content: Just fantastic! Much better than using stand alone emulators or retroarch. Very easy to use and looks amazing!

I had to download custom pics off the internet and load them myself. Not sure if this will happen with any other systems.

I just tested TG CD and was able to scrape images. Please emails me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com and I'll do everything I can to help you out with this! Thank you!

content: Just wanted to say this is the FIRST app I ever bought on the Play Store. A suggestion: The ability to create custom playlists for games, would be great. But amazing app. 5 stars!
Great front end , easy to use but need to add sega saturn emulator support for yaba sanshiro 2 version
Really great. Are there any plans to add the new psx emulator, duckstation? Update: Since posting this you have added it. Fantastic app worth every penny
Not great. I like a lot of what they have implemented but the interface is clunky. Please streamline. Fiver is steep for what feels like it is still in beta.
Fantastic and easy to use front end for all the games you can throw at it. No fuss catalog management!
Sweet as!!!
Total garbage! Doesn't auto scan and add box art at all. Very useless when you have about 30k old games...use DIG instead.
Great app been using it for quite sometime but please add nintendo switch with egg emulator. Thank you

I wish there was an option for TEN STARS!! Thank goodness that team referred me to the RESET Collection. After adding one of my many libraries to this system, I am HOOKED!!! This is an amazing app and easily worth $20! Get this now and enjoy the retro life on Android!!!
The app is glitchy, it keeps on crashing when its creating a collection. Ui could use some work. I wouldnt recommend it.

Amazing frontend. Easy to set up, works well. Using it on the Retroid Pocket 2. Developer is very responsive and helpful with any questions, and really works to continue to add the more things that people request.
please fix orientation issue,even if lock its still follow device default orientation...,thanks

Awesome app. The new update allows android games too. Only downside is scraping images for the android games isnt providing images.. New update fixed my android scraping problem. I have to say this app has turned my phone into a museum for games. The best.

content: The perfect frontend for the Retroid Pocket 2. Simple setup, lots of customization options and built in scraping. Excellent support from very responsive developers.

This is a great frontend for android OS really the best there is iv been gaming since the 89 and love retro I have coin ops and launch box in my pc this give me the same feel they do and it's super easy to set up and great for beginners keep up the great work I love the apk on my shield:)

Fantastic app, easily my favourite. It looks amazing, you can customise it more to your liking. It brings everything together nicely. I can't recommend it highly enough. I'm using it with standalone apps rather than Retroarch.

The app is great, but after update 1.1.0.2 some of my colletions broke and dissapered suddenly (n64 collection was empty) and I couldn't readd them back in, some of my games won't add back to the collection, in the previous version all was good, but now they broke, all the image downloads is broken and freezes on adding pics.
replyContent: Hi Gus, thanks for the post! I'm sorry about the issue. I actually just pushed a new version (1.0.03) that should fix the issue of missing games. After you get the new version launch RESET, the missing games should be back! Let me know if that's not the case or if there are other issues by emailing me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com. Thanks!

content: good but needs more improvements

The best frontend for Android! I was hesitant at first to buy it, but it was worth every penny. I like it because it takes care of all the heavy work for you quickly and it's very easy to edit the games if you want to change it. I've used it on a Samsung S20, Pixel 3a, and even the Retroid Pocket 2 without any problems. They are very responsive for updates too! Thanks~

As someone who has emulators on every device I own, as well as currently using different front ends on all those devices, I give this app 5 stars, hands down the best front end software I have seen on any android device. I currently am using it on my samsung galaxy tab s6, and my nvidia shield tv. The entire setup is clean, fast, and easy to use. I currently have a 512GB microSD card in my tablet with a couple thousand games and Reset found them all. I only had to add box art for a couple NeoGeo roms I had which easily was fixed when i changed the name of the rom to the correct spelling for the scraper to work. Systems I am currently using and have tested and can say works perfectly are : Full romsets for 3 different MAME/Arcade versions (mame 0160, 2003 and FBA), NeoGeo, Super Nintendo, Nintendo, Sega Genesis, Sega CD, Sega 32X, Sega Dreamcast, Nintendo 64, Nintendo Game Cube, Turbo Graphix 16, Sony PSP, Sony Playstation 1, and Panasonic 3DO. My only wish or hope is that right now you can change individual roms artwork to the boxart, boxart 3d, cartridge etc, but you have to do them all individually. I wish there was a way i could change the entire collection to show the 3D boxart , or all the medium (cardridge, CD, etc) right now it defaults to Boxart, which is totally fine and looks great, it just would be nice if we could change them all if we wanted to. Also there aren't clear instructions anywhere that I could find on how to scrape again for new artwork etc. I was able to add new artwork by choosing a folder that contained it on my device. Again these are small things, I think anyone using emulators on their androids need to download this app.
Kept crashing every time I tried to start a game.
replyContent: Hey Kevin, thanks for posting! I'm so sorry that you're experiencing crashes when you start a game. I definitely want to help you out with troubleshooting this so you can get to retro gaming using RESET! Can you please email me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com? Looking forward to helping you out with this! Thanks and take care!

content: RESET Collection has me giddy with excitement for the possibility of having my retro collection all in one place on my TV. The great. It let's you choose between several backgrounds, box art etc for systems and games, giving you the ability to choose the aesthetic that best suits your tastes. You can also add your own. It's snappy to navigate, this is on an Nvidia shield TV PRO 2019 mind you. Not so good is that it can crash scraping large collections. Can't rescrape systems or games.
This frontend is amazing, although it has some bugs its still the best frontend on the playstore. But it would really be nice if there were themes. Overall amazing!
replyContent: Hi Edrick. Thanks for taking the time to post a review. I'm sorry about these issues. I'm working on some major updates to the app to work out some hiccups. But I'd love to help out now with the issues you're experiencing. Please email me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com so we can see if we can get RESET working for you in its current state. Thanks!

content: Finding yourself stuck in a rut with your run of the mill frontend? Can't stand crazy slow boxart scraping? Tired of an overly complicated setup process? Why not push the RESET button? Fast. Beautiful. Simple. I Dig it üòâ

The design of RESET looks flawless and is very easy to use. Extremely happy with the app, definitely a competitive Front End for the price. It offers good customizability and will be able to scrape all of your game covers along with videos for each game. The direct support I received from the developer was really quick, accurate and helpful too. Can't go wrong with it RESET
It seems you've gone quiet on this app which is a shame

Awful. Developed by Jav? More like developed by Java, because this is nothing but GARBAGE Collection. A slick, simple interface? Easy, quick setup? Video previews dynamically streamed, saving you time and storage space? Yes, this miserable app has all of that. It's as simple as this: RESET will make your games collection feel timely and cohesive. Stay away!
This is a great front end, there are improvements that can be made in the future but right now it works really well, I highly recommend it

Great front end but I wish there was a way to delete games showing up but the possibility of selecting more than 1 would be great.. Instead of selecting 1 and then having to scroll and delete another and over and over again..
Great app cheap too

Quite unreliable, sometimes I add a platform and it's missing from the list, sometimes the same platform shows twice after adding one, of course users have to make sure to change the location of the scrapped media to the SD card because if you want to change it afterwards it will just lose all the media and you will have to remove and add each platform again. Please add an option to re-scrape a collection, or to re-check if the media is again available after it's gone, and please fix all the issues with platforms disappearing, now if I try to add my PSP collection it says it cannot find anything, after I already added it (it didn't populate the list). Also, is there a way to prevent most of the screen from being used by the purple RESET logo when choosing platform?
replyContent: Hey Diego, thanks for posting! I'm so sorry for these hiccups that you're experiencing. I'm working on making performance optimizations and general bug fixes like the ones you're experiencing. Also will add features in the future to re-scrape and change image directories & UI customization. Questions? email me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com. Thx!

content: So far it's pretty darned amazing. Has absolutely everything I could ever want from a front end, except for broader support for emulators for some the less popular platforms. I'd like to see some more options for Atari Jaguar, for example, such IrataJaguar was pulled from the Play Store, and retroarch is way too complicated. And some of the systems ONLY let you use RetroArch. So yea, I'd like to see more emulators supported (hence 4 stars instead of 5) but otherwise, this is FANTASTIC, and I'd buy it again in a heartbeat!

This is a great front loader for multiple emulator system. The only thing I hate is how there is no option to reduce the size of the reset logo/description. To save memory and storage space on my phone. I have to uncheck multiple art and video description for my games. Now I just have a huge reset logo taking up 2/3 of the screen real-estate. I want to see more of the game library instead of the logo/game description. Please add this option and I will surely change my rating. -Paid User

I can't add any systems. When i try to access my external drive for the rom path by clicking "emulated" it freezes. Drive is recognized by all other Android TV apps. Dev does this application support NTFS file system? *Updated* Reinstalled and no longer had the same issue. Overall it's good just a bit slow at times with random behavior in the menu. Good solid foundation to build off though.
replyContent: Thanks for posting! Sorry you're having issues on your Android TV device. I have tested on my Shield TV, but I haven't tried testing on any other Android TV. I'd love to hear what device you're using so I can help fix this issue. Please send me an email at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com and I'll help you out! Thanks!

content: Used to be good,but now the top part takes over 60 percent of the screen and the app takes way too long to open compared to the Samsung games launcher

I want to love this front end! Its got an amazing look. It is simple to setup. It has so many awesome features like video previews. BUT, it can only seem to load a very small number of games at a time. I have alot of GB, GBA, SNES, SEGA. I want to see them all lined up... but this thing just can't do it. It really struggles to have them all loaded and by that I mean it just can't. It crashes or takes 2-3 min to load when I start it. If this application could do what it has set out to do it would be the best. I guess I will crawl back to DIG and wait for this to get better.

Good start for Android frontends, begging for love of God the option to disable backdrop images, 9 times out of 10 they look deviantart-tier terrible, wastes space in my storage, and aren't related at all to the game it's downloaded for. There's no option to get rid of them, please consider this for a future update.
Awesome, and much needed app. I would really like to see an option to fill the screen with games for a single system (and scale how big the box art is displayed). Well worth the asking price
The creator always listens to feedback and tries to constantly improve this app.

Excellent front end, would highly recommend if you are using different emulators and want an intuitive way to browse through your collection without going in and out of apps constantly. There are also YouTube videos which help break everything down and make setting up the front end easier with clear and concise information. No issues or anything negative to report during time using it for last few months
Awesome frontend for classic video games, is as good as PC frontend's.

After cooling down and talking to the very good people at reset I have changed my review to 4 stars . the app looks great but at this time can not handle a huge game collection but they took great care of me and are working to fix it so if you want a app that looks great and people that will work with you pick this up cause i got a feeling its going to be great
replyContent: Hi Pete! Thanks for the post, and I very much appreciate that you sent me an email regarding the issues you were experiencing with RESET. You gave me a lot of good suggestions and advice, and I'll be taking what you said to heart and applying it to a future release. Thanks again for the message, and please take care, friend!

content: I think developer has nailed the early stages. We are not spoiled for choices with front-ends for android and I give this dude credit for creating something with so much potential. There are a few bugs to iron out, but for the price and experience you won't go far wrong with this.
Update: After clearing out the cash and the data it completely fix the issue 5/5

Great for your retro collection Only wish it was accurate when sorting where the files go to which system and would be nice if there was an easier way to edit and wish all edits would not glitch as in the background art work goes blank at times. Excellent app. Loving it so far. I would like to see the following added. I know its still in its infancy, so the developer probably has these on his list. 1) set location of images that have previously been downloaded for each system so it will bring those images back. 2) change display type to carousel etc, and image size for game covers. 3) search for game name and system. 4) Game type filters, and company filter etc. 5) speed of game scrolling. Add fast skip etc. Keep up the amazing work

content: the best Android emulator front end

replyContent: Hello! Thanks for posting! Sorry for this negative experience with the NAS. I also have a SHEILD and a Synology NAS that I mount as storage. content: I purchased this on my spare phone I use for emulation to test it, but wants me to pay for it again on my main phone I use and obviously take with me, both logged into the same Gmail account through the app store, surely I shouldn't have to pay for it again on main phone as it's shows buy it instead of download it? Edit...thanks for the info how to fix this issue. Hopefully gets updated with different layouts and theme's, overall great fronted so far
replyContent: Thanks for posting, Adam! I've noticed that this is an issue for many apps on the Play store, probably due to some sync issue. A workaround is to log in to your account on a web browser and navigate to the Play Store. Then go to RESET Collection, click on the "Install" button, select your device, and this will initiate an install from there!

By far, best emulator frontend for Android! I've tried them all. This is the best one! Easy to use and intuitive. content: *new edit, this dev is amazing responds to feed back highly reccomend this to anyone and everyone who emulates thank you!!! Really love it such an amazing ui amd awesome simple features. only question I have is will it support portrait mode eventually?
replyContent: **UPDATE: RESET now supports portrait orientation as of version 1.0.19!** Thank you so much! I'm glad RESET is working out for you! I'm definitely going to add portrait mode in the future. I have a few key features that are higher priority at the moment, but I promise it's coming!

content: Great front end for emulation with active developer support and improvements through regular updates. I recently swapped over from Launchbox and have no regrets.
Very nice frontend, but it lacks a main menu to quickly select the system, and an option to delete unused pictures.
Amazing gaming front-end application for accessing and presenting your games in an easy-to-navigate way. It feels like netflix. By far one of the best purchases I've made on android.
Not to experienced with emulator frontends but this one has gotta be the best. Easy to use and everything just works. Customization for days and the Dev is a awesome guy.
Thank you.
replyContent: Thank you for informing me of this. I'm very truly sorry that this is happening. One of my priorities is to work on performance optimization, and those improvements will be in a future release. However, I understand if you want to receive a refund now. Please contact me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com so I can get more info from you for the refund.

content: Best front end I've ever used! Just hoping for a Dolphin MMJ save state fix soon so I can launch GameCube/Wii from this excellent frontend as well.

amazing. is a really simple to use.Best game fromt on google play. for 5 dollars is just a still. (this review is coming for a person who doesn't buy apps,but this is such an amazing app that had to support the team). so yeah i recommend this app 100%.

Best front-end out there. Really easy navigation and clean design. I love the detail of trivia on scraping download screens. After your done with a game, if you back out it returns you to the front-end and closes the emulator automatically. Well designed. Or the removal of box/logo art etc. Also I would like to see Nostalgia.NES supported.

Thank you for this update, I was thinking about this, be able to flip the landscape orientation and the add of android because I have apps and emulators that they are not in the app store like Beta stuff like that so I can call them now. I love it, keep it up
replyContent: Hello! Thanks for the review! Also wanted to update you that RESET now also supports portrait orientation! üéÆ üïπ

beautiful interface, please add an app theme color.. please ") thanks , i'm using this on tvbox

content: This emulator front end works great. Found all but a few games no problem. Retroarch needs to learn a thing or two from this guy. Love the game info and artwork. Great job! Worth every Penny.

At the moment I still prefer Dig mainly cause being themeable its very customizable so you can make it look a lot different to the stock UI & there are quite a few themes to choose from but I do like the optional video steaming preview for games in Reset, nice touch. But if you are new to front ends then you are probably better off with Reset Collection as its easier to set up and navigate. I may revisit Reset in the future & see how it develops but credits to the dev on a good start.

Best frontend on Android. My issues are just nitpicky and can easily be fixed. Add a vertical mode, and make a better logo and banner to represent the app, the current reset logo just looks unprofessional.
Is nice, but needs and overall box view. Appreciate the search function, but just a single line of boxes isn't enough, especially on Android TV. Good app otherwise!
Excellent Frontend, Any plans to add scummVM on a update soon?.. waiting to add my collection.
The app is super great, but display at pocophone f1 miui 10 is cut off, can you add dolphin ishiiruka ? Thanks
Great app
replyContent: Thanks for leaving a review! Really means a lot to me that you think RESET is a great app! Take it easy!

I'll be working on performance optimizations and bug fixes after the next release which will be adding Android native games as a system. Definitely keep an eye out for improvements and new features! content: Amazing. Only thing stopping this from being perfect for me is some kind of button override combination to quit directly back to reset collection menu... replyContent: Howdy! Thanks for your review!!! Adding Android TV channel customization is on my to-do list. It is quite a long list, so apologies if it takes a while before I get to this. Thank you, and take care!

content: This frontend is brilliant, not only does it scrape all your artwork it also reduces the storage capacity by using urls for video snaps instead of large video files. Easy to use with a clean user interface. Love it üòç

Came across throught a youtuber andi'm impressed. Happy to se that you had updated 2 more emulators (which I was about to comment ). Well done. $ well sp3nt for me. Some improvements.... There are some games which prodcued wrong artwork...and updated tag (example on 3DS - pokemon x, pokemon y and pokemon sun) which is surprise to me)

Great frontend experience! The only thing holding it back from 5 stars is the addition of some Japan systems (mainly, PC Engine, PC Engine CD...and Supergrafx, to name a few). I know you can probably merge them with their us counterparts, but I'd like not to crowd the US games with Japanese ones. Thanks for your hard work!
The dev is working on this continuously, there has been weekly updates to fix bugs and add features.
replyContent: Hello friend! Network storage devices mounted on Shield TV by selecting "Storage - Mount network storage" are now supported in the latest version (v1.0.14). As long as the network storage is mounted, you'll see it when selecting ROM folders when adding a system. Thanks again for bringing this to my attention, and sorry it took so long to add this!

content: Great job!! Btw, resident evil zero on gamecube is using resident evil 3 background for some reason

Worth Every Penny for my Setup, portable DeX/Screen mirror gaming setup. Support for almost every emulator I use. Only feature I would like is a way to add specific files to a database. It's a personal thing, but I keep most roms in one folder and it will recognize the similar file type for one console instead of another. Otherwise, none complaints.
You can new update add PlayStation 2 Damonps2 or ppss22 please and thanks
replyContent: Hello! Thank you for leaving a review üëç I was able to add DaomonPS2, however I have contacted the developer to get information on how to launch into the game from a frontend. Until I get this info from the developer, RESET will only be able to open the DamonPS2, at which point you'll have to launch the ROM from within DamonPS2. Sorry for this!

content: Great front end. If you use emulators, this is a must buy. Only 1 problem. Every time I use my n64 emulator, I have to go into the actual emulator app to map my controller. Wish the settings would save for all the games using the same n64 emulator.

Great launcher. Heavily customizable and looks great. I wish there was an auto rotate feature for between the 2 possible landscape positions as I have to flip over my phone to whenever I'm not in the correct one.
replyContent: **UPDATE: RESET now supports portrait and flipping landscape positions!** Thank you for the review!

content: First days scraping a system was fast. Now I cant even add one game fix without taking time. Still best frontend I needed for retroarch mame roms. Keep it up good job. How do I fix roms hiding in other roms? Like megaman 1 gb hiding in megaman 2 or final fantasy legend hiding in final fantasy legend 2. Gameboy
replyContent: Hi! For the ROMs hiding in other ROMs, sounds like the scraping algorithm is matching both games as the same game. Can you try renaming to "Mega Man II" and "Final Fantasy Legend II", so replace '2' with 'ii''. Then remove the problem games, go to system and select "Scan for new games." Now you should see all games. Email me please if otherwise!

content: Worth Every Pennnyyyy Id Give 30 Stars If They Had That Many Better Then Arc Browser And Launch Box And HyperSpin It Easy To Intalll Like Coin Ops Great Emulator Front The Best So Far For Android

Great app and worth the purchase price, now i can have all my emulators under the one roof, very happy!! Great app to keep everything looking neat and easy to use. Absolute must if you love retro gaming and can see this app getting better with new updates and themes etc. Keep up the good work.

I am 26 years old and I've played a lot of retro games and modern games, i am one of those obsessed and crazy gamers, yeah i don't collect physical games anymore because they're a waste of space when you can find them digitally and if you couldn't organize them the way you want them to be... I personally would like to see support for two other emulators and it seems they will be supported in the future. Do yourself a favor and pick it up.

Excellent Emulator front end - just fantastic - great development! Just some small suggestions please - 1/ A way to manage artwork. Give me a way to change where it scrapes from, or a way to tell it to check a folder locally and try and match every game name with starting part of the name like name% I would love it to be able to retry scraping etc with more options so I can finally get 1000's of games with artwork to bulk scrape and update automatically - yes I can do this 1 by 1 but that is crazy :) I love you app though, a great front end to both RetroArch and loads of other android emulators. Evcen the wife loves it!! Keep the new features coming my friend, thank you!

Currently the only & best active frontend emulator! Because the LaunchBox for Android is on hold (which I own), I decided to get this too. And it's great! replyContent: Thank you for your review! Sorry RESET is missing that core and PCE.emu. I'll add it to the list of emulators and cores that I need to add. Currently working on some other items on the to-do list, but I'll try to have these in within 2 - 3 weeks!

content: Absolutely love this frontend. It's my favorite for the Shield TV so far and I think I've tried them all.

content: Great front end so far. I have a very large rom collection. I like the fact that it uses YouTube to save on space. The only thing I would like would be a YouTube video search function instead of having to find URLs if that is at all possible. Either way great work
replyContent: Thanks for the review! That is a very cool idea! It should be possible, although a bit of a bigger feature that requires time to design the experience and code. I'll add it to my to-do list, but be warned I have a long to-do list of improvements and new features!

content: Fantastic app. Only reason I am not giving 5 stars is it needs a portrait mode as there are tons of emulator games I play in portrait mode. Hoping for an update!
replyContent: **UPDATE: RESET now supports portrait mode as of version 1.0.19!** Thanks for the review!

content: Excellent frontend, the only problem that I have is running out of internal storage for artwork and images. Would be great if artwork could be stored on external drive. Developer responded instantly! You can download artwork to an external drive.
replyContent: Hello! Thanks for the review! You definitely can change the download location for images! Go to the Settings top menu, then select "Image download folder location" and you should see a location pointing to your external drive. The only unfortunate thing is RESET doesn't have a function to move artwork right now, so you'll have to redownload images.

content: I use Arc browser and Dig but this is hands down becoming my favorite front end i just have one request can you add the Nostalgia emulators to the templates if it's possible
replyContent: Thanks for the review!!! Glad to hear you're enjoying RESET! As long as the Nostalgia emulators support launching from outside apps, I should be able to add them to RESET! But please give me a bit of time, currently working on some bug fixes and adding Android native games as a system (which is a bit different than other systems). Take care!

content: Great emulator frontend, infact the best one I've found & I've tried them all. I use to use DIG but have now switched to Reset as my go to launcher. replyContent: Thank you for picking up this app and leaving a review! I have quite a to-do list of improvements, and one of the major updates I'll be adding to RESET will be another theme, as well as more ways to customize the themes. Thanks again for the review, and take care!

content: Really good front end but Unable to add android games to your collection If possible an option to put a pin to enter the settings menu would be great. It would stop the kids messing up the set-up once you have spent hours setting up the collection.
replyContent: Thank you for your review! The next feature I'm working on is adding Android games!. And thanks for mentioning adding a pin to lock settings and modifications! I'll add that to my to-do list. But may I suggest creating a backup by going to Settings - Back up data, which you can use to restore in case too many things get messed up by the kids :)

content: Great front end emulator. Not sure if I will be changing from DIG just yet, as there are a couple of minor differences which have a big impact to me. 1) Customize theme and layout. I would prefer to have a smaller top section when browsing games. 2) Game search, per system. With some systems having 600+ titles (NES) it can be painful scrolling around looking for the title. Note: DIG appears to be abandoned by the dev. RESET Collection is clearly being updated very frequently.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Adding new themes and ways to customize aspects of themes, as well as a search function for games are improvements that are on my to-do list! And just to make sure you're aware, you can scroll quickly through a collection by bringing up the game menu and selecting "Scroll to" and choosing a letter. Hope that helps for now!

content: I just installed this and all I can say is wow. Scraping is fast. It would be cool to pick the scraper used, or maybe even the media sources, but all in all, turned out solid. Looks great on my Razer Phone 2 with my Jungle cat controller. Easy access to my RETRO games on the fly! Looking forward to the Android games add on!
replyContent: Thanks for your review! Means a lot to hear that RESET is working out for you! I definitely do want to add more scraping sources in the future. Once I do that, I'll let users pick which source they'd like to use. I am curious about what you mean about "media sources." If you have time, please email resetcollectionapp@gmail.com about this. Thanks!

content: This is amazing, definitely one of the best frontends on the market. Easy to use, great visual presentation, scraping data is relatively quick. Secondly, it will not scrape my mame collection. If those two things are corrected. This would be easily be the best frontend I've used on Android
replyContent: Thanks for your review! There are a few systems I'm planning on adding - Android native games, ScummVM, DOS, Atomiswave. Let me know if there's something else you're looking for. As for MAME, sorry that RESET isn't scraping that collection. It has scraped MAME for others. Can you please contact me and I'll help! resetcollectionapp@gmail.com

content: Came from launchbox and not disapointed. I am not able to get final burn neo working though. Works within retroarch fine but through the front end i just get a black screen and stops responding message appears. Other than that this app is just short of perfect
replyContent: Howdy! First off, thank you for your generous review! I'm bummed FBN isn't working. I have another user that has also informed me of this issue, so I'll be looking into it and putting in a fix. Please give me a few weeks though. content: Almost 5 stars for me.if we could just get pce.emu support for pc engine cd games it's retroarch only right now.
replyContent: Thanks for the review! Sorry PCE.emu doesn't show, I'll add it in future, but workaround you can do- add your PCECD system like normal with RetroAarch. Then for that system, go to that system's menu (by long pressing on the PC Engine system box art)- Set emulator for all games- TurboGrafx 16- PCE.emu. Need help?  resetcollectionapp@gmail.com

content: I love this Emulation Frontend! I just got some questions. I have a NVIDIA Shield running the updated android 8 ver. replyContent: Thanks for the review! RESET doesn't have Damon as an emulator option. I'll look into adding it. content: Just wish there was vetical mode and a way to see the back of boxes since they are downloaded anyway

Brilliant easy to use frontend, It is easier than anything that came before on Android. Just scan your games, choose your emulator and within minutes you have a really tidy, quick interface. Very impressed so far. One negative is occasional hiccups when scraping images.
replyContent: Thank you for your review! It means a lot that RESET users are enjoying the app! Of course, I'm trying to make it as painless and smooth experience as possible. I have heard a few folks bring up these scraping "hiccups" and occasional download image freezes (but always able to continue on retry). I'll be working on improving/fixing this for sure!

content: Fantastic app & just what I've been looking for as a frontend. Really user friendly & helpful developer. Would love to see Scummvm & ms dos added but they are notoriously difficult to work with any frontend. Hopefully final burn alpha will be added soon. Great work.
replyContent: Thank you so much for the review! RE Final Burn Alpha, RESET does have multiple FBA RetroArch cores available under the Arcade system. Check 'em out and let me know if something else needs to be added. And for MSDOS and Scummvvm, I'll definitely put the effort into adding those into a future release (I also hear they're bit difficult to work with!)

content: A fantastic looking front-end that's not only super tidy but also super intuitive. Any issues I had were easy to solve (usually required locking certain emulators to landscape mode). Absolutely brilliant and I can't recommend it enough, especially if you've got a few emulators you're juggling with.
replyContent: Thank you for the review! I'm really sorry that you're experiencing this issue on your device! I really want to fix this for you! If you don't mind, can you please send me an email so I can update you on my findings? My email can be found on last page of "Display Tutorials" in top menu of the app. Thanks!

content: Excellent frontend but a slight problem. It saves all photos/scans for game art it downloads to device memory. Was loving the whole app and its pro look untill "memory is full" popped up on my nvidia shield tv. It taken up over 8 gigs of space in downloaded covers and box art etc and i had no way to move it to my external storage/usb drive. UPDATE: Developer has updated app so external storage is now used. Very quick to respond. 5 stars. Excellent work and well done!
replyContent: UPDATE: I just released a new version of RESET that allows you to select from some options on where to save images! If RESET detects an external drive, it'll list that as an option as well. Due to some limitation with certain versions of Android, won't be able to save just anywhere on ext storage, must save to special folder where apps can save.

content: Keeps getting better with every update. Love the app. I have a question for the dev. Is it possible to implement scummvm and magic dosbox in future updates like dig?
replyContent: Thank you for your review, and I'm glad you're loving the app! I'm definitely planning on adding more systems and emulators. These are some of the ones I have on my todo list for sure! The todo list of new features and new systems is pretty long, so I appreciate your patience for dosbox and scummvm! I'll get to it as soon as I can. Thanks!

content: GPD XD+ Review: I've used Arc, Dig, and RetroX and this is definitely one of my favorite front ends. This front end is VERY polished and works very well. Setting up a new console is very intuitive and scanning is very fast. Although scanning times will vary from user to user based on network connection and device performance, my XD+ was able to scrape ~500 Gameboy games and download front, back, screenshots, fan art, etc in ~5 min. The only suggestion I would have at this point is to allow L1 and R1 to scroll to the next/previous letter. Example, if in SNES on a game that starts with L; R1 will take you to the first M and L1 will take you the first K game. Keep up the great work! Definitely looking forward to the next releases.
replyContent: Thanks so much for the awesome review! It really means a lot! I hear you about having a convenient way to skip forward/back in a collection other than the "Scroll to" menu option... I can't use L or R buttons as those are used for scrolling description and RW/FF videos... but I'll think of something. Maybe use the right analog or something. Thanks!

content: The best games frontend on Android. The aesthetic is beautiful and the UI is simple. The updates keep improving it and the dev is incredibly responsive and kind. This is definitely worth the purchase!
replyContent: Thank you very much for your review! It's great to hear that you're down with the aesthetic. I'll definitely keep the updates coming!

content: Great frontend maybe one of the best. What would make it better is having afba,atomiswave and naomi also. Hope they do. The reset collection developer just made this frontend the best out there adding the video snap of the games on the background, Definitely a nice touch of how cool and easy the developer makes it for the user. He also added more emulators including naomi, can't wait for the atomiswave. But right now this definitely became the best frontend in the retro gaming. A++++
replyContent:
Thank you for your review! I'm honored you think RESET is one of the best frontends! I'm working hard to make it work for as many emulation enthusiasts as possible!

There are RetroArch cores for arcade, and a few versions of FBA. I'll do some thorough testing and update the app if necessary. Will also look into adding NAOMI and Atomiswave. THANKS!

content: how easy is to setup the same collection on multible andriod devices,,, i have a samsung tab 4 and nvidia shield
replyContent: Thank you so much for your review! It means a lot hearing from users and getting reviews! I'm glad RESET is working well and you find it easy to set up! A great user experience when setting up your games was one of my main goals when I created this app. I'm going to do my best to continue to improve every gamer's experience using RESET Collection!

content: I have Retrox, Arc Launcher, and Dig. This is by far the easiest to set up. Simply select to add a system or console of your choice and where your roms are located. Options are given to add box art, banners, carts, backrounds, descriptions, and more from a single menu. I use full no-intro sets with over 3000 roms. Adding that much only takes a few minutes. Reset has much promise. Add video snaps would be nice. User friendly, inexpensive, & scrapes well. Cant wait for updates. Try it for yourself
replyContent: Thank you so much for downloading RESET and giving it such praise! I really appreciate the review! THANK YOU! I will definitely keep adding updates, improvements, and of course new features. Right now I'm working on allowing users to backup and restore their data. And as for playing/streaming video for a game, that's on my list of features to add!

content: Thanks for adding dolphin mmj! there is a problem though where once I select a Wii or GameCube game it still takes me to normal dolphin instead of mmj so you can probably fix that in the next update but still the best frontend I've ever used! Edit: it's fixed now thanks for the update!
replyContent:
[Edit: No prob! One day I'll add a way to download new emulators and emulator fixes... until then, I'll try to have fixes in within a week!]. 
I'm so sorry about that! I definitely do see that I made a mistake in my code when I added Dolphin MMJ, doh! Sometimes one can get lazy when copy and pasting things! Sorry again, next update will have a fix!

content: Wow! I wish I had found this app prior to spending money on other emulator frontends, because this looks SLEEK! I'm using an Nvidia Shield, & this is phenomenal on a television. I'm setting it up with a Netflix-esque appearance and it's looking amazing in it's infancy. EDIT: The saving issue was fixed! Can't wait to see the future of this app.
replyContent:
Thank you so much for your review!

I'm sorry that there is a problem with saving backdrops. I just tested the latest version of the app on my Pixel, and changed backdrops show upon restarting. I will test tonight on my Shield to see if I can recreate there. Can you please email me at resetcollectionapp@gmail.com and I'll make sure to update you.

content: Best
replyContent: Thanks for taking the time to rate RESET Collection!
